ovs.middleware package¶

Submodules¶

ovs.middleware.permissions module¶

Middleware to allow for user role based endpoint control.

class ovs.middleware.permissions.Permissions(role)[source]¶

Bases: object

Requires that the user who accesses the decorated route has the correct permissions. :param role: The minimum role required to access this route.

Returns:A func that does the permission checking.

Examples

routes that need authorization should apply the decorator like so:

from ovs.middleware import permissions @bp.route(‘/my_admin_only_route/’, methods=[‘GET’]) @permissions(roles.ADMIN) def my_admin_only_route():

…
__call__(func)[source]¶

This function is an implementation detail of decorators. See ovs.middleware.Permissions :param func: The decorated function.

Returns:A function handled by python.

Module contents¶

Contains any middleware decorator functions we might need
